DOC.brief_summary: To access the effectiveness of cyclophosphamide combined thiotepa and carboplatin chemotherapy combined with adoptive cellular therapy with dendritic and cytokine-induced killer cells in triple negative metastatic breast cancer patients
DOC.brief_title: Study of Chemotherapy With Adoptive Cellular Therapy With DC-CIK Cells in Triple Negative Breast Cancer Patients
DOC.detailed_description: 1. Metastatic breast cancer patients should be definitively diagnosis based on histopathology, with ER-negative and PR-negative, FISH testing for her-2-negative 2. All the patients enrolled will be given standard cyclophosphamide combined thiotepa and carboplatin chemotherapy and cellular therapy.Cellular therapy consisting of one cycle of chemotherapy followed by an apheresis and ex vivo cultures to generate DC and CIK, followed by low-dose Oral Cyclophosphamide . 3. The response is assessed using Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumor Group (RECIST) guidelines. 4. Estimate time to progression, survival rates and clinical benefit response on patients. 5. Find biomarkers associated with drug response.
DOC.criteria: Failure to anthracycline and/or taxol chemotherapy; metastatic tumor is histologically confirmed by immunohistochemical staining to be ERnegative and PRnegative. FISH testing for her2negative; Metastatic tumor can not be removed through surgery procedure; An Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status of 02; Normal cardiac, hepatic, renal and bone marrow functions; Life expectancy â‰¥3 months.
